wikipedia_page.main: John Stark Thomson (18 February 1903 – 1976) was a British freestyle swimmer who competed in the 1924 Summer Olympics. In 1924 he was a member of the British relay team which finished fifth in the 4×200-metre freestyle relay.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1924 Summer Olympics
response: |align=left| Harold Annison  Albert Dickin  Edward Peter  Leslie Savage*  John Thomson

Leslie Savage (16 March 1897 – 26 August 1979) was a British freestyle swimmer who competed at the 1920 and 1924 Summer Olympics. In 1920 he won a bronze medal as a member of the British team in the men's 4×200-metre relay, and competed in the semifinal of the 100-metre freestyle. In 1924 he swam the final leg in the first qualifying heat of the 4×200-metre relay event as a member of British team, but was later replaced by John Thomson in the semifinal and final. The British team finished in a fifth place.

link_mentions.page: Swimming at the 1924 Summer Olympics – Men's 4 × 200 metre freestyle relay
response: Sweden replaced Thor Henning and Gösta Persson with Arne Borg and Åke Borg and Great Britain replaced Leslie Savage with John Thomson. Both teams advanced to the final.
